intro: Houstonia angustifolia var. filifolia, commonly known as the narrowleaf bluemink, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family, which includes many species of flowering plants. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and pine flatwoods. Its small, blue to purple flowers bloom in spring, and its leaves are narrow and grass-like. The variety filifolia is distinguished by its fine, thread-like leaves, which give it a delicate appearance.
